note.p: Burial: English cemetery of San Benigno, Genoa

Career: Named James Lewis Macie as a child, he changed his name from Macie to Smithson, and while in France changed it again to 'de Smithson', to be seen as a Milord anglais. Bequest to USA valued at $500,000 and until John Quincy Adams took a hand, the US was thinking of turning the money down. Established the Smithsonian Institution with Â£104,960 (Act of Congress 1846)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1830-1831 No 1 pp 8-9
Notes: Ewing, Heather 'The Lost World of James Smithson' Bloomsbury (2007)
